alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 21 at 8:03PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including Central and Western Los Angeles County and much of Ventura County. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM PST, numerous showers continued across the advisory area. Some of the showers were moderate to heavy. Earlier today, moderate to locally heavy rain caused minor flooding across the area, with widespread ponding of water on roadways. Shower activity is expected through at least the early morning hours Friday, and there is a slight chance of thunderstorms. Widespread ponding of water is likely on many roadways, with flooding of low lying areas and intersections through at least 1 AM PST Friday. In addition, isolated rock and mud slides are expected, especially in and below steeper terrain. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Oxnard, Thousand Oaks, Simi Valley, Ventura, Camarillo, Fillmore, Malibu, Acton, Ojai, Chatsworth, Agoura Hills, Woodland Hills, Northridge, Santa Clarita, Encino, Van Nuys, North Hollywood, Burbank and Griffith Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
